sdp_rule.name: OS Certified?
sdp_rule.sdp_command: import $OS_NAM,$OS_VER,$OS_BIT,$OS_ARC if match($OS_ARC,'itanium',true) {call setHcveResult(check($OS_VER,\ '^10\.20$',concat($OS_NAM,' ',$OS_VER,' is not certified with 11g R1 RDBMS'),\ '^11\.00$',concat($OS_NAM,' ',$OS_VER,' is not certified with 11g R1 RDBMS'),\ '^11\.11$',concat($OS_NAM,' ',$OS_VER,' is not certified with 11g R1 RDBMS'),\ '^11\.23$',cond(expr('==',$OS_BIT,32),\ join(' ',$OS_NAM,$OS_VER,$OS_BIT,\ 'bit is not certified with 11g R1 RDBMS'),\ 'Certified with 11g R1 RDBMS'),\ '^11\.31$',cond(expr('==',$OS_BIT,32),\ join(' ',$OS_NAM,$OS_VER,$OS_BIT,\ 'bit is not certified with 11g R1 RDBMS'),\ 'Certified with 11g R1 RDBMS'),\ concat($OS_NAM,' OS version not determinable'))) } elsif match($OS_ARC,'pa-risc',true) {call setHcveResult(check($OS_VER,\ '^10\.20$',concat($OS_NAM,' ',$OS_VER,' is not certified with 11g R1 RDBMS'),\ '^11\.00$',cond(expr('==',$OS_BIT,32),\ join(' ',$OS_NAM,$OS_VER,$OS_BIT,\ 'bit is not certified with 11g R1 RDBMS'),\ 'Certified with 11g R1 RDBMS'),\ '^11\.11$',cond(expr('==',$OS_BIT,32),\ join(' ',$OS_NAM,$OS_VER,$OS_BIT,\ 'bit is not certified with 11g R1 RDBMS'),\ 'Certified with 11g R1 RDBMS'),\ '^11\.23$',cond(expr('==',$OS_BIT,32),\ join(' ',$OS_NAM,$OS_VER,$OS_BIT,\ 'bit is not certified with 11g R1 RDBMS'),\ 'Certified with 11g R1 RDBMS'),\ '^11\.31$',cond(expr('==',$OS_BIT,32),\ join(' ',$OS_NAM,$OS_VER,$OS_BIT,\ 'bit is not certified with 11g R1 RDBMS'),\ 'Certified with 11g R1 RDBMS'),\ concat($OS_NAM,' OS version not determinable'))) } else call setHcveResult('Architecture not certified for 11g R1 RDBMS')
sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule checks for the correct version of HP-UX required for installing Oracle Database 11g.

sdp_actions.sdp_action: The correct version of HP-UX is installed on your server.

!!SHOWSTOPPER!! You do not have the correct version of HP-UX installed on your server. For the certified versions of HP-UX, see the ''Oracle Database Installation Guide 11g Release 1 (11.1) for HP-UX'' and My Oracle Support.

sdp_rule.name: User in /etc/passwd?
sdp_rule.sdp_command: call setHcveResult(cond(\ not(testFile('r','/etc/passwd')),\ 'Can not read /etc/passwd',\ grepFile('/etc/passwd',\ concat('^',$usr = first(command('/usr/bin/id -nu')),':'),\ 'f'),\ 'userOK',\ concat($usr,' not in /etc/passwd.')))
sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule verifies that the user name of the user who runs this script is in the ``/etc/passwd`` file.

sdp_actions.sdp_action: The ``/etc/passwd`` file contains the user. No action is required.

The ``/etc/passwd`` file does not contain the user or else the file has no read permissions. Add the user to the ``/etc/passwd`` file if the user does not exist in the file. NIS-managed users are not recommended.

sdp_rule.name: Group in /etc/group?
sdp_rule.sdp_command: call setHcveResult(cond(\ not(testFile('r','/etc/group')),\ 'Can not read /etc/group',\ grepFile('/etc/group',concat('^',command('/usr/bin/id -ng'),':'),'f'),\ 'GroupOK',\ 'Group not in /etc/group'))
sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule verifies that the group to which the user belongs exists in the ``/etc/group`` file.

sdp_actions.sdp_action: The ``/etc/group`` file contains the group of the user. No action required.
ALERT: The ``/etc/group`` file does not contain the group. Add the group to the ``/etc/group`` file.

sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule prompts the user for the planned Oracle home directory.

sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule checks for the Oracle home directory.

sdp_rule.sdp_command: import $ORACLE_HOME call setHcveResult(cond(\ not(defined($ORACLE_HOME)), 'OHNotSpecified',\ not(testDir('d',$ORACLE_HOME)),'OHNotExist',\ not(testDir('r',$ORACLE_HOME)),'NoReadPerm',\ not(testDir('w',$ORACLE_HOME)),'NoWritePerm',\ not(testDir('x',$ORACLE_HOME)),'NoExecutePerm',\ 'CorrectPerms'))

|*Return Value*|*Action*| |NoReadPerm|Ensure that the install user has read permissions for the Oracle home directory| |NoWritePerm|Ensure that the install user has write permissions for the Oracle home directory| |NoExecutePerm|Ensure that the install user has execute permissions for the Oracle home directory| |OHNotExist|The Oracle home directory does not exist. No way to retrieve the external job user

sdp_rule.name: EXTJOB User Name

sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule asks the name for the local user used for the external jobs.

sdp_rule.name: EXTJOB User Defined?
sdp_rule.sdp_command: import $EXTJOB_USER call setHcveResult(cond(\ grepCommand(concat('/usr/bin/id ',$EXTJOB_USER),'\buid=','fi'),'Defined',\ 'NotFound'))

sdp_rule.name: oraInventory Permissions
sdp_rule.sdp_command: call setHcveResult(cond(\ not(testFile('f','/var/opt/oracle/oraInst.loc')),\ 'oraInventoryNotFound',\ not(testFile('wr',$INV_LOC = \ value(grepFile('/var/opt/oracle/oraInst.loc','^inventory_loc','f')))),\ 'oraInventoryNotOK',\ 'oraInventoryOK')) call setHcveVariable('$INV_LOC')
sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule verifies that the user installing Oracle Database 11g has sufficient privileges for the ``oraInventory`` directory.

sdp_actions.sdp_action: Either the user, who is logged in, has sufficient privileges for the ``oraInventory`` directory to install Oracle Database 11g or this is the first Oracle product to be installed on the system. In that case, the installer creates the ``oraInventory`` directory. No action required.

The user, who is logged in, cannot access (write) the ``oraInventory`` directory while installing Oracle Database 11g. Verify that the user can write to the directory specified in the ``/var/opt/oracle/oraInst.loc`` file. |*Return Value*|*Action*| |oraInventoryNotOK|Make sure that the install user has write permissions to ${INV_LOC}| |oraInventoryNotFound|The ``/var/opt/oracle/oraInst.loc`` file was not found. This is not a problem if this is the first Oracle installation on the system.|

sdp_rule.name: Umask Set to 022?
sdp_rule.sdp_command: call setHcveResult(cond(\ expr('==','022',command('/usr/bin/umask')),'UmaskOK','UmaskNotOK'))
sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule checks that the ``umask`` value is set correctly for installing Oracle Database 11g.

sdp_actions.sdp_action: The ``umask`` value is set correctly for installing Oracle Database 11g. No action required.
The ``umask`` value is not set correctly. Set the ``umask`` to 022 before installing Oracle Database 11g.

sdp_rule.name: ulimits OK?
sdp_rule.sdp_command: var @tbl =() macro get_ulimit_unl {var (\@tbl,$nam) = @arg var $lmt = field('\s+',1,grepLastFile(concat('^',$nam,'\('),'if')) if !defined($lmt) call push(@tbl,concat($nam,'NotDefined')) elsif compare('ne',$lmt,'unlimited') call push(@tbl,concat($nam,'TooSmall')) } macro get_ulimit_val {var (\@tbl,$nam,$ref) = @arg var $lmt = field('\s+',1,grepLastFile(concat('^',$nam,'\('),'if')) if !length($lmt) call push(@tbl,concat($nam,'NotDefined')) elsif and(compare('ne',$lmt,'unlimited'),expr('<',$lmt,$ref)) call push(@tbl,concat($nam,'TooSmall')) } call loadCommand('/usr/bin/ulimit -a') call get_ulimit_unl(\@tbl,'Time') call get_ulimit_unl(\@tbl,'File') call get_ulimit_val(\@tbl,'Data',1048576) call get_ulimit_val(\@tbl,'Stack',32768) call get_ulimit_val(\@tbl,'Memory',2045680) call setHcveResult(cond(scalar(@tbl),join("\012",@tbl),'ulimitOK'))
sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule verifies that the ``ulimit`` settings are adequate for installing Oracle Database 11g.

sdp_actions.sdp_action: The ``ulimit`` settings are adequate for installing Oracle Database 11g. No action required.

Review the ``ulimit`` settings and check the recommended values from the ''Oracle Database Installation Guide 11g Release 1 (11.1) for HP-UX'' before installing the software. |*Return Value*|*Action*| |TimeNotDefined|ulimit(TIME) is not defined| |TimeTooSmall|Increase the ulimit(TIME) to unlimited| |FileNotDefined|ulimit(FILE) is not defined| |FileTooSmall|Increase the ulimit(FILE) to unlimited| |DataNotDefined|ulimit(DATA) is not defined| |DataTooSmall|Increase the ulimit(DATA) to a minimum of 1048576| |StackNotDefined|ulimit(STACK) is not defined| |StackTooSmall|Increase the ulimit(STACK) to a minimum of 32768| |MemoryNotDefined|ulimit(MEMORY) is not defined| |MemoryTooSmall|Increase the ulimit(MEMORY) to a minimum of 2045680|

sdp_rule.name: Other O_Hs in PATH?
sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule checks that the PATH variable does not contain any references to other Oracle home directories based on the /var/opt/oracle/oratab entries.

sdp_rule.sdp_command: call setHcveResult(cond(\ grepCommand('/usr/bin/ps -ef','runInstaller','i'),'AnotherOUIup',\ 'NoOtherOUI'))
sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule checks for another active ``runInstaller`` process on the system.

sdp_actions.sdp_action: No other ``runInstaller`` process is running. No action required.

sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule checks that there is sufficient space available for storing temporary files during the Oracle Database 10g installation.

Make sure your temporary space has at least 400 MB of free space.| |TMPDIR invalidDir|ALERT - ``TMPDIR`` is set to ${`RULE.A00230.TMPDIR} in the environment; however, ${`RULE.A00230.TMPDIR} is an invalid directory. Take appropriate action.| |TMPDIR NoWrite|ALERT - ``TMPDIR`` is set to ${`RULE.A00230.TMPDIR} in the environment; however, the user does not have write permissions to ${`RULE.A00230.TMPDIR}.| |TMPDIR tooSmall|ALERT - ``TMPDIR`` is set to ${`RULE.A00230.TMPDIR} in the environment; however, ${`RULE.A00230.TMPDIR} has less than the required 400 MB of free space. sdp_rule.name: Swap (in MB)
sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule shows the amount of free swap space.

sdp_rule.name: RAM (in MB)
sdp_rule.sdp_command: if grepCommand('/usr/contrib/bin/machinfo','Memory\s*[=:]\s*(\d+)\s*MB','f1') call setHcveResult(last) else {var $mem = nvl(\ field('\s+',6,grepFile('/var/adm/syslog/syslog.log','Physical','f')),\ field('\s+',6,grepFile('/var/adm/syslog/OLDsyslog.log','Physical','f')),\ field('\s+',1,grepCommand('/usr/sbin/dmesg','Physical:','f')),\ cond(getSetting('NO_CSTM'),0,\ expr('*',1024,match(grepCommand(\ "/usr/bin/echo 'selall;info;wait;infolog;view;done' | /usr/sbin/cstm",\ 'Total Configured Memory','f'),'\:\s+(\d+)\s+MB'))),\ 0) call setHcveResult(expr('/',$mem,1024)) }
sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule verifies that your system has sufficient physical memory installed to install Oracle Database 11g.

sdp_actions.sdp_action: You have sufficient physical memory (MB) installed to install Oracle Database 11g. No action required.
ALERT: You do not have sufficient physical memory (MB) in your system to install Oracle Database 11g.

sdp_rule.name: SwapToRAM OK?
sdp_rule.sdp_command: var $swp = "%A00250%" var $mem = "%A00260%" call setHcveResult(cond(\ not(isNumber($swp)), 'SwapNotDetermined',\ expr('<',$swp,1610), 'InsufficientSwap',\ not(expr('>',$mem,0)), 'MemNotDetermined',\ and(expr('>',$mem,1024),expr('<',$mem,2048)),\ cond(expr('<',$swp,expr('*',$mem,1.5)), 'SwapLessThanRAM','SwapToRAMOK'),\ and(expr('>',$mem,2049),expr('<',$mem,8192)),\ cond(expr('<',$swp,$mem), 'SwapLessThanRAM','SwapToRAMOK'),\ expr('>',$mem,8192),\ cond(expr('<',$swp,expr('*',$mem,0.75)),'SwapLessThanRAM','SwapToRAMOK'),\ 'SwapToRAMOK'))
sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule verifies that the total amount of swap space is greater than or equal to the amount recommended by the ''Oracle Database Installation Guide 11g Release 1 (11.1) for HP-UX''.

sdp_actions.sdp_action: The amount of swap space meets the minimum requirement for installing Oracle Database 11g. No action required.

The amount of swap space is less than the amount recommended by the ''Oracle Database Installation Guide 11g Release 1 (11.1) for HP-UX''. Verify the requirements and adjust your system accordingly. |*Return Value*|*Action*| |SwapNotDetermined|ALERT- A Swap to Memory ratio cannot be determined because swap is not set up or you do not have execute permissions to determine swap| |SwapLessThanRAM|ALERT- Swap space is less than the physical memory. Set swap space to at least the same size as the physical memory| |InsufficientSwap|ALERT- Oracle Database 11g requires at least 1.5 GB of swap space| |MemNotDetermined|ALERT- A Swap to Memory ratio cannot be determined because you do not have execute permissions to determine the physical memory|
